item.title: "esc" to logout
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:27, topic:523554”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=642101.msg4325119#msg4325119 date=1372774475]
^ an array is a container it can hold whatever is needed

[size=1pt]within certain limits [/size]
[/quote]

You still don’t know how ints work[/quote]an int is like a cash stack for positive/negative. but there can regulations in that. I think of it like math.

you can make a variable/word (or in math a letter lol) have a value numberwise.

So when you have an int that’s int blah = 345.

ah but you see if z = blah and z = 345 then you can reverse engineer.

anarray = (345, 0 , 0)

come now who says you can’t have an int such as mining?

the int is the numberical value for pickaxes, the array is going to be the numbers inside.

horrible with java terminology.

p.s. never said I was an actual programmer. Which I always found ironic. I have practiced making little things before for people but I don’t studiously study/play around with it.

Read full topic

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:18, topic:523554”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=642101.msg4324798#msg4324798 date=1372713304]

er aren’t errors thrown when you have a negative int? ~^

no?
[/quote]NegativeArraySizeException can be thrown from negative int’s :p[/quote]
Well in this case it would be an index out of bounds, not a negative size, and if you would look in the client it is very easy to see they use -1 to indicate no interface being shown and therefore appropriately handle a negative integer.
